title: Error whist recomputing - ForkChoiceError, find_head failed
body:
## Description

Lighthouse beacon and validator client were running smoothly for several days, but after a hard reboot the beacon client is no longer syncing to latest state and constantly loops on error `Error whist recomputing head`

## Version

`sigp/lighthouse:v3.1.0`


## Present Behaviour

Running lighthouse as docker container with the command:
```
lighthouse bn --network mainnet --debug-level debug --staking --http-address ${HTTP_ADDRESS} --metrics --execution-endpoint ${EXECUTION_ENDPOINT} --execution-jwt ${JWT_PATH} --suggested-fee-recipient ${FEE_RECEIPIENT_ADDRESS}
```

Despite healthy peer count, the beacon node is looping with error syncing to latest state and continues to fall behind in slot distance


## Expected Behaviour

Beacon should sync from last stable state persisted in the database

## Steps to resolve

I do not know of a way to resolve other than deleting the beacon chain and resyncing beacon from scratch

Edit: Issue resolved itself after several restarts and switching to a different version of Execution Client Erigon

This is an issue with your execution node. It is telling Lighthouse that valid blocks from the canonical chain are invalid, so Lighthouse is left without a valid head to sync to. Once you fix your execution node to stop reporting valid blocks as invalid (probably by re-syncing it) then Lighthouse will be able to recover by restarting (i.e. no need to re-sync Lighthouse).

Which execution client are you running?

>This is an issue with your execution node. It is telling Lighthouse that valid blocks from the canonical chain are invalid, so Lighthouse is left without a valid head to sync to. Once you fix your execution node to stop reporting valid blocks as invalid (probably by re-syncing it) then Lighthouse will be able to recover by restarting (i.e. no need to re-sync Lighthouse).

That makes sense, I'm running [erigon v2022.09.03](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/tag/v2022.09.03)

After several restarts and switching to a different version of my execution client, the issue seems to have resolved itself. I've updated the issue with an edit that includes what steps I took to resolve. 

As a result I am comfortable with the team closing this ticket, thank you very much for the fast and helpful response!
No worries! Glad to hear you got it sorted :blush:
